intro: Cryptocarya acuminata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cryptocarya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to Australia, particularly found in the eastern regions of Queensland and New South Wales. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves, which are elliptical in shape and have a pointed tip. It typically grows as a small tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Cryptocarya acuminata is often found in moist, well-drained soils in rainforest or sclerophyllous vegetation.
